item.title: How to get actual login username when using sudo su
item.description:
I’ve had the need to find out the actual username of someone logged in and working as root (via sudo su -) to put it into a subversion commit message. This quick little bash script does the trick, and just echos the username.

#!/bin/bash

PID=$$ # get PID of current …

item.title: Apache2 - list Name-Based Virtual Hosts
item.description:
Here’s a little tidbit that I never knew until I had an Apache2 name-based virtual host problem: httpd -S lists the vhosts that are being served by Apache, and how they were parsed from the config files.

The output on one of my servers looks something like:
